sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Pope Francis addresses the crowds outside St. Peter's Basilica in Rome, urging healthcare for all, vaccines for the poor and lamenting many conflicts around the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Catalonia reimposes a night-time curfew along with other restrictions on gatherings and

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: businesses to fight a surge in Covid-19.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Thirty years on, Russians voice mixed feelings about Mikhail Gorbachev's resignation at the end of the Soviet Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Pope France uses Ubi et Orbi, Christmas address from St. Peter's Basilica in Rome,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: to argue for healthcare for all, vaccines for the poor and the resolution of various conflicts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Specifically, this year the pontiff lamented violence in Syria, Yemen and Iraq, while also mentioning bursting tensions in Ukraine and Ethiopia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: He said, God is with us, grant health to the infirm and inspire all men and women of goodwill to seek the best ways possible to overcome the current health crisis and its effects.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Open hearts to ensure that necessary medical care and vaccines in particular are provided to those peoples who need them the most.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Repay those who generously devote themselves to caring for family members, the sick and the most vulnerable in our midst.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: This year, crowds were reduced due to the ongoing pandemic, although they were larger than last year when the Pope broadcast a message from the Apostolic Palace to deter crowds from gathering outside.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Bethlehem's Church of the Nativity held a slightly subdued morning service on Saturday,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: celebrating the second Christmas under the pandemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It was led by Patriarch Pier Battista Pizzaballa, the top Catholic clergyman in the Holy Land, and it was attended by hundreds of churchgoers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In pre-pandemic times, thousands of pilgrims and tourists from around the world celebrated in the church and the adjacent manger square.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Square. Catalonia, home to the city of Barcelona, reimposed a night-time curfew from Christmas Eve lasting for 15 days to fight a record surge in Covid-19 infections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: A raft of other restrictions were also implemented, which will affect the community's 7.7 million people and hamper New Year's celebrations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: This bar owner says it's very complicated because with the situation, tourists will no longer come to Barcelona.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Everything is cancelled.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We've had a good night for now because we've only had these new restrictions for two days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But now it's going to get worse and I'm very afraid not being able to have a normal 31st or end of the year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Spain had hoped for a relaxed festive Christmas since 80% of its population of 47 million were vaccinators. But the incredibly fast spread of the Omicron variant is starting to put pressure on hospitals, with Catalonia having a quarter of all admittances in Spain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Catalonia having a quarter of all admittances in Spain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: At least 13 people died after a migrant boat capsized off the coast of Greece.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's the third accident with loss of life in as many days, with at least 27 people confirmed to have died in Greek waters this week alone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The sinking scum as people's muglers favour a more perilous route from Turkey to Italy, avoiding Greece's heavily patrolled Asian islands.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A humanitarian ship carrying a group of 114 people rescued in the Mediterranean more than a week ago has been directed to the Sicilian port of Trapani.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The organization running the Ocean Viking boat welcomed the news.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A doctor on board explained how people feared spending Christmas abandoned.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We are stranded at sea with 114 people that we rescued over a week ago from a vessel in distress.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Amongst these survivors we have two newborns who are facing spending their first Christmas with us here on board and their mothers who have faced death and are continuing to suffer with us on board. As per maritime law, a rescue is only complete when the survivors have been disembarked in a place of safety.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: More than 200 migrants rescued by another humanitarian boat, the CI4, were allowed to disembark in the port of Pozzalo in Italy on Friday. In total, the German vessel has saved more than 1,400 people in distress at sea over the past year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Mikhail Gorbachev's resignation as president of the Soviet Union brought an end to a communist

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: empire that had shaped world history for nearly 70 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But today, three decades later, Russians look back with decidedly mixed feelings. One pensioner said that life was good under the Soviet Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We lived well, peacefully, quietly, everything was fine. And then came just traitors, so to speak. Gorbachev ruined the Union, Yeltsin the drunkard helped.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I know that my parents were very interested in it, and it left a mark on them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But I'm a citizen of modern Russia now, and before you told me, I didn't even know about that date.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: On Friday, Gorbachev summed up his feelings now by saying that Washington grew arrogant and self-confident after the Soviet Union collapsed, and that led to the expansion of the NATO military alliance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: On December 25, 1991, the Soviet red flag was lowered over the Kremlin forever.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I am stopping my activities as the President of the USSR.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Pavel Palashenko worked as Mikhail Gorbachev's interpreter from 1985.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Currently he is the head of international and media relations at the Gorbachev Foundation and advisor to Mikhail Gorbachev.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Mr. Palashenko shared with Euronews his side of the fall of the USSR 30 years ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We published a book under the editorship of Mikhail Gorbachev called The Union Could Have Been Preserved.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Its main idea is that it was impossible to keep the Soviet Union in its former form. And now that is especially clear.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: in its former form, and now that is especially clear.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: When the country's leadership realised this, it decided to take the path of signing a new treaty with the republics, where the republics themselves decided what powers they would have and what they would voluntarily delegate to the Union Centre.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I believe that this was the right path.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Conflicts, wars between republics, what we are witnessing now, I think, would have been much less likely.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: What are the main reasons for the fall of the USSR?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: There were two main blows, the Auguste Coudetat and the Belavezh Accords.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: These are the two main reasons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Of course, the desire of the republics to build their own nation-states played a role.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The diverse nature of the republics that made up the Soviet Union played a role.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It's very difficult to keep together such a heterogeneous group of republics, such as Estonia or Turkmenistan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But nevertheless, I think that in some shape or form, it was still possible to keep most of the republics together.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Critics say that one of the reasons for the collapse of the Soviet Union was the delay in the implementation of economic reforms.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: How can you interpret this criticism of Mikhail Gorbachev?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: I think that over the past 30 years, we've become convinced that economic reforms are extremely difficult, a very difficult, very slow business.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And therefore, those who criticize him for not being able to do this in three, four, five years, they are mistaken.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Although there is certainly some truth, economic difficulties certainly played a role in the decline of Gorbachev's popularity and in the desire of the republics to climb out of this situation on their own.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Kosovo has introduced rolling two-hour blackouts due to an overloaded system, according to the electricity distributor, who are now calling for maximum savings to be made.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: A unit malfunction at the country's main coal plough plant compounded normal winter demand surges, necessitating costly imports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Local production now only meets a third of consumption needs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In the state of Kentucky, a team of volunteers has ensured families hit two weeks ago by

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: a string of tornadoes have something to celebrate Christmas with.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In the town of Mayfield, the volunteers have served over 30,000 meals since the disaster struck.
